unnormalised: Urban planning in India requires a holistic approach. The emphasis should be on sustainable development, considering the needs of all citizens, from the affluent in Mumbai to the marginalized in rural Bihar. We need effective implementation, not just grandiose schemes. The policies need to be reviewed every 5 years, say, by 01/01/2030. Think of the Smart Cities Mission inaugurated on 25/06/2015, and its progress till now at 17:00 hrs today. Are we truly building "Ram Rajya" in our cities? The National Institute of Urban Affairs has crucial research that needs application.
